item.title: C++ Development environment in Emacs
item.description: Introduction This set up already starts with wsl (version 2) already installed and emacs as well. Emacs on windows with WSL2 | Nasser's personal website This guide also is helpful to set up emacs for c++ development: Configuring Emacs as a C/C++ IDE - LSP Mode - LSP support for Emacs. Emacs Lsp-mode clangd server Language server that provides intelligent features to emacs via lsp-mode.

item.title: PhD setup
item.description: Emacs Emacs, of course. Tried briefly overleaf, it was good first. Nice to have instant previews and so on. But then, it got little complicated with the bibliography export from Zotero. If I add a reference to zotero I have to manually update the bibliography, and it also takes some time to update. Real downside. Another minor problem that I anticipated is when I create figures with scripts, I would have to manually upload then (?
